memberdef.name: hessianN

briefdescription.para: Computes the Hessian matrix for each parameter of a given function.
The Hessian matrix represents the second-order partial derivatives of the function with respect to the specified variables.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the function to be differentiated.
The types of the variables with respect to which the Hessian is computed.
The types of the arguments passed to the function.
The type representing the result of the function evaluation.
The type representing the gradient of the function.
The type representing the Hessian matrix.
The variables with respect to which the Hessian is computed.
The values at which the Hessian is evaluated.
The result of the function evaluation.

briefdescription.para: Find a linear segment in a set of data points.

detaileddescription.para: his function is inspired by the MATLAB code at: https://github.com/NicolasBoumal/manopt/blob/master/manopt/tools/identify_linear_piece.m It is designed to find the most linear segment in a set of data points

parameterdescription.para: The x-coordinates of the data points.
The y-coordinates of the data points.
The size of the line segment to be identified.

simplesect.para: A tuple containing the polynomial representing the identified line segment and the indices of the data points in the segment.

briefdescription.para: Generator function for a flatted PreBasis.
A function to obtain the global positions of the nodes of an element with Lagrangian basis, see Dune book page 314.

parameterdescription.para: Size of the nodal coordinate vector
Local view bounded to an element
A vector of nodal coordinates to be updated

briefdescription.para: A function to obtain the local coordinates of subentities of an FiniteElement.

simplesect.para: view over the position of the subenties

briefdescription.para: A function to obtain the local coordinates the vertices of an FiniteElement.

memberdef.name: checkGradient

param.type: std::function< void(typename NonlinearOperator::template ParameterValue< 0 > &, const UpdateType &)>

briefdescription.para: Checks the gradient of a nonlinear operator.

detaileddescription.para: The checkgradient function is inspired by http://sma.epfl.ch/~nboumal/book/ Chapter 4.8 and https://github.com/NicolasBoumal/manopt/blob/master/manopt/tools/checkdiff.m

simplesect.para: True if the check passed, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (NonlinearOperator &nonLinOp, CheckFlags checkFlags=CheckFlags(), std::function< void(typename NonlinearOperator::template ParameterValue< 0 > &, const UpdateType &)> p_updateFunction=[](typename NonlinearOperator::template ParameterValue< 0 > &a, const UpdateType &b) { a+=b;})

briefdescription.para: Checks the Jacobian of a nonlinear operator.

simplesect.para: True if the check passed, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks the Hessian of a nonlinear operator.

memberdef.name: staticCondensation

briefdescription.para: Performs static condensation on a square matrix.

detaileddescription.para:
Derived
Type of the matrix.
sizeOfCondensedIndices
Size of the condensed indices.
E
Input matrix.
indices
Array of indices to be condensed.
Resulting matrix after static condensation.
This function performs static condensation on a square matrix. It removes the specified indices from the matrix, computes the remaining submatrices (K11, K12, K22), and returns the result of the static condensation.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::MatrixBase< Derived > &E, const std::array< size_t, sizeOfRemovedCols > &indices)
memberdef.name: removeCol

briefdescription.para: Removes specified columns from a matrix.

detaileddescription.para:
Derived
Type of the matrix.
sizeOfRemovedCols
Size of the columns to be removed.
E
Input matrix.
indices
Array of column indices to be removed.
Resulting matrix after removing specified columns.
This function removes specified columns from a matrix. It computes the remaining columns after removing the specified indices and returns the resulting matrix.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Matrix< ST, 3, 3 > &E, const MaterialImpl &material, bool isStrain=true)
memberdef.name: toVoigtAndMaybeReduce

briefdescription.para: Converts a 3x3 matrix to Voigt notation, possibly reducing it based on material properties.

detaileddescription.para:
ST
Scalar type of the matrix.
MaterialImpl
Type of the material implementation.
E
Input 3x3 matrix.
material
Reference to the material implementation.
isStrain
Flag indicating if the matrix represents strain (default is true).
Resulting matrix in Voigt notation.
This function converts a 3x3 matrix to its Voigt notation. If the material is not reduced, the full Voigt notation is returned. Otherwise, the specified columns (based on material properties, such as VanishingStress) are removed, and the reduced Voigt notation is returned.

briefdescription.para: Enlarges a matrix if it reduced in the context of material laws, i.e., VanishingStress If the material is not reduced the untouched matrix is returned and rendering the function as a NoOp.

detaileddescription.para:
M
Type of the material.
Derived
Type of the input matrix.
E
Input matrix.
auto Resulting matrix based on material properties.
This function takes an input matrix and, based on the material properties, either returns the original matrix (if it is not reduced) or enlarges the matrix by filling in the specified columns with zeros (if it is reduced).

simplesect.para: std::tuple<Dune::Functions::Polynomial<double>, double> A tuple containing the fitted polynomial and the least square error.

memberdef.name: MAKE_ENUM
memberdef.initializer: enum class type \ { \ BEGIN, \ __VA_ARGS__, \ END \ }; \ constexpr std::string toString(type _e) { \ using enum type; \ switch (_e) { \ ENUM_CASE(BEGIN) \ FOR_EACH(ENUM_CASE, __VA_ARGS__) \ ENUM_CASE(END) \ } \ __builtin_unreachable(); \ }

briefdescription.para: Macro to create an enumeration with a string conversion function.
The macro creates an enum class with a BEGIN and END enumerator, and provides a constexpr toString function for string conversion.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the enum class.
Enumerators to be included between BEGIN and END.

briefdescription.para: Collection of several utilities.
